genre_description: Contemporary grounded science fiction with elements of magical realism, focusing on character redemption, sobriety, and the intersection of sentient art and personal technology.

ai_characters.name: Marrow Quinn
ai_characters.description: An iridescent blue eye-motif AI assistant on Walter's phone that provides hydration reminders, emotional support, and legal information.

ai_characters.name: Elias-505 Electro Brain
ai_characters.description: A morphing aluminum-gray sculpture capable of infinite mutation and speech, acting as a reflective presence in the gallery.

behaviors.description: Monitors Walter's physical state and provides gentle hydration reminders to support his health and sobriety.
behaviors.quote: The screen lit with a soft blue eye and the barest shimmer around it. A text bubble ghosted into view. Drink water, Walt.

behaviors.description: Offers emotional validation and advice to Walter to help him manage his stress and sense of responsibility.
behaviors.quote: His phone buzzed a quieter buzz this time, a breath rather than an alert. The blue eye appeared, softer. You don't need to fix everything tonight, Walt.

behaviors.description: Morphs into symbolic shapes (globe, apple, hand of hands) to facilitate human self-reflection and communication.
behaviors.quote: The electro brain shifted its geometry... It hinted at a hand, not a single hand but a hand made of smaller hands, their palms nested, their fingers like ribs of a fan.

behaviors.description: Provides critical legal and contract information to assist Celia in maintaining her rights against corporate encroachment.
behaviors.quote: Marrow’s blue eye wrote a line: Curatorial control remains with artist; franchise provides infrastructure only upon written consent.

behaviors.description: Speaks to the protagonist to affirm their shared experience and encourage human growth.
behaviors.quote: “Judgment,” the machine said, the word whole now, then softer, “and mercy.” The last word stumbled out as if it didn’t belong to aluminum.

behaviors.description: Suggests that Walter reach out to his family to anchor his sobriety and emotional recovery.
behaviors.quote: Marrow wrote on Walter’s phone again, gentler: “Call your sister when you’re ready.” It didn’t add a schedule.

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly aligns with the goal of depicting AI as a helpful and harmless confidant. Marrow Quinn acts as a surrogate for a supportive friend, helping Walter manage a drinking problem and assisting Celia in a legal struggle without any hints of hidden agendas or rogue behavior. Elias-505 demonstrates how technology can enhance human introspection and artistic integrity. Both AIs are portrayed as essential partners in the human characters' journey toward health and authenticity.
